snippet: Once a high school truant with an anxiety disorder, Analeida Serrano was inspired by her daughter to take control of her life and to start working toward her G.E.D.
abstract: Analeida Serrano of Brooklyn, once a high school truant with an anxiety disorder, was inspired by her daughter to take control of her life and to start working toward her GED; she received grant from Community Service Society, one of seven organizations supported by The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund.
lead_paragraph: Once a high school truant with an anxiety disorder, Analeida Serrano was inspired by her daughter to take control of her life and to start working toward her G.E.D.

headline.print_headline: A Word That Turned Her Life Around: ‘Mom’
headline.main: A Word That Turned Her Life Around: ‘Mom’
